categories.title: Risk Indicators
categories.subtitle: 13 water risk indicators from WRI Aqueduct 4.0

groupDescriptions.quantity_variability: Physical water availability, demand, and temporal fluctuations
groupDescriptions.flooding: Flood risk from rivers and coastal areas
groupDescriptions.access_reputational: Water access, sanitation, and governance risk

baseline_stress.name: Baseline Water Stress
baseline_stress.desc: Ratio of total water withdrawals to available renewable water supply
baseline_stress.detail: Measures the competition for water resources. Higher values indicate greater stress on water supplies from human demand.

baseline_depletion.name: Baseline Water Depletion
baseline_depletion.desc: Ratio of water consumption to available renewable water supply
baseline_depletion.detail: Indicates the portion of water withdrawn that is not returned to the system. Higher values mean more permanent water loss.

groundwater_decline.name: Groundwater Table Decline
groundwater_decline.desc: Average decline rate of groundwater table
groundwater_decline.detail: Measures groundwater depletion trends. Higher values indicate faster decline in groundwater levels over time.

interannual_variability.name: Interannual Variability
interannual_variability.detail: Shows uncertainty between years. Higher values indicate less predictable water availability from one year to the next.

seasonal_variability.name: Seasonal Variability
seasonal_variability.detail: Indicates seasonal water availability patterns. Higher values mean greater differences between wet and dry seasons.

drought_risk.name: Drought Risk
drought_risk.detail: Based on historical drought events from 1950-2014. Shows areas with higher historical drought frequency.

riverine_flood_risk.name: Riverine Flood Risk
riverine_flood_risk.desc: Population exposed to 1-in-100 year riverine floods
riverine_flood_risk.detail: Indicates percentage of population living in areas at risk of major river flooding based on flood return period models.

coastal_flood_risk.name: Coastal Flood Risk
coastal_flood_risk.desc: Population exposed to 1-in-100 year coastal floods
coastal_flood_risk.detail: Shows coastal flood exposure for provinces with coastline. Inland provinces show zero or minimal risk.

untreated_wastewater.name: Untreated Connected Wastewater
untreated_wastewater.desc: Percentage of collected wastewater not treated before discharge
untreated_wastewater.detail: Indicates water quality threats from untreated sewage. Higher values mean more pollution risk to water bodies.

coastal_eutrophication.name: Coastal Eutrophication Potential
coastal_eutrophication.desc: Nitrogen and phosphorus export to coastal waters
coastal_eutrophication.detail: Measures nutrient pollution that can cause algae blooms and oxygen depletion in coastal areas.

unimproved_drinking_water.name: Unimproved Drinking Water
unimproved_drinking_water.desc: Population without access to improved drinking water sources
unimproved_drinking_water.detail: Percentage of population lacking safe drinking water access. Higher values indicate greater access challenges.

unimproved_sanitation.name: Unimproved Sanitation
unimproved_sanitation.desc: Population without access to improved sanitation facilities
unimproved_sanitation.detail: Indicates sanitation infrastructure gaps. Higher values show greater need for sanitation improvements.

reputational_risk.name: RepRisk Index
reputational_risk.desc: Peak RepRisk country ESG risk index
reputational_risk.detail: Country-level environmental, social, and governance risk indicator. Same value across all provinces.

combined.name: Combined Physical Risk
combined.desc: Weighted average of physical risk indicators
combined.detail: Overall physical water risk score combining quantity, variability, flooding, and quality indicators. Access/reputational indicators displayed separately.

methodology.title: Methodology
methodology.subtitle: How we calculate water risk scores
methodology.dataSourceText: We use official WRI Aqueduct 4.0 datasets derived from the PCR-GLOBWB 2 global hydrological model developed by Utrecht University.
methodology.processingText: Sub-basin level data is aggregated to Turkey's 81 provinces using area-weighted averaging to ensure accurate representation.
methodology.scoringText: Each indicator is scored on a 0-5 scale following WRI's methodology. The combined risk uses weighted arithmetic mean with weights assigned by WRI researchers.
methodology.githubRepoDesc: Full code, data processing pipeline, and documentation available.

about.title: About This Project
about.subtitle: Open-source water risk assessment for Turkey
about.description: This project provides transparent, data-driven water risk assessments for Turkey's 81 provinces using real WRI Aqueduct 4.0 data. All code and data processing pipelines are open-source and reproducible.
about.dataText: Primary data from WRI Aqueduct 4.0, based on PCR-GLOBWB 2 hydrological model, with additional validation from Turkish government sources (DSİ, TÜİK).
about.licenseText: Code: MIT License. Data: Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 (CC BY 4.0). Free to use with attribution.
about.contributeText: This is an open-source project. Contributions, suggestions, and data improvements are welcome.
about.contactText: Questions or feedback? Open an issue on GitHub or reach out via email.
